derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French, from Latin patent- 'lying open', from the verb patere

entry.def: A patent is an official right to be the only person or company allowed to make or sell a new product for a certain period of time.

example.ex: P&G applied for a patent on its cookies...
example.tran: 宝洁公司为它的饼干申请专利权。

example.ex: He held a number of patents for his many innovations...
example.tran: 他拥有多项发明的专利权。

entry.def: If you patent something, you obtain a patent for it.

example.ex: He patented the idea that the atom could be split...
example.tran: 他获得了“原子可以再分”这一概念的专利权。

example.ex: The invention has been patented by the university.
example.tran: 那项发明已被那所大学申请了专利。

entry.tran: （尤指坏事物）明显的，显而易见的
entry.def: You use patent to describe something, especially something bad, in order to indicate in an emphatic way that you think its nature or existence is clear and obvious.

means.word_mean: 1. a document granting an inventor sole rights to an invention
2. an official document granting a right or privilege
2. grant rights to; grant a patent for
3. make open to sight or notice;

sentences.sentence: "His behavior has patented an embarrassing fact about him"

means.word_mean: 1. (of a bodily tube or passageway) open; affording free passage;
2. clearly apparent or obvious to the mind or senses;

sentences.sentence: "the effects of the drought are apparent to anyone who sees the parched fields"
"it is plain that he is no reactionary"
